intro: Mollinedia rusbyana, commonly known as the Rusby's mollinedia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
